H0.text: Streak is a more reliable trait or measure to identify minerals.

H1.text: Color is a more reliable trait or measure to identify minerals.

H2.text: Shape is a more reliable trait or measure to identify minerals.

H3.text: Weight is a more reliable trait or measure to identify minerals.

A4.text: Colour is the most obvious property of a mineral, but it is often non-diagnostic.

A5.text: The trail of finely ground powder generally has a more consistent characteristic color, and is thus an important diagnostic tool in mineral identification.

A6.text: However, when the specimen is dragged to produce a streak, it is broken into randomly oriented microscopic crystals, and small impurities do not greatly affect the absorption of light.
